panels.description: This includes all the available file system space in the system includes root (/) and other directories
panels.title: File System Space Total Available

panels.description: Gives the root Disk Space given to the system
panels.title: Total Disk Space

panels.description: Gives the amount of Disk Used by the machine
panels.title: Disk Space Used

panels.description:
https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/linux-file-hierarchy-structure/
- This gives the amount of disk space available in the root directory

This only shows the root directory available space.This includes /bin, /boot, /dev, /etc, /home, /lib, /media etc
panels.title: Disk Available (Root directory)

panels.description:
Based on the root (/) directory, dividing the available space with total space gives the total amount of available in percentage by multiply with 100. 
- By removing the available percentage from 100 will give you the utilized percentage.
panels.title: Disk Space Utilization

panels.description:
Filesystem used space.
> If is > 80% then is Critical.
panels.title: Filesystem Space Used

panels.description:
Number of seconds CPU spent 
running a process.
panels.title: cpu spent time

panels.description:
Mount Points are directories.
tmpfs (short for Temporary File System) is a temporary file storage paradigm implemented in many Unix-like operating systems. It is intended to appear as a mounted file system, but data is stored in volatile memory instead of a persistent storage device.
panels.title: File System Space Available

panels.description: The weighted # of seconds spent doing I/Os.
panels.title: Disk IO Saturation

panels.description:

Gives the amount of space available in the different directories of given machine
panels.title: File System Space Available
